headline.main: RUSSIANS PROBE LINES TO LEARN NAZI PLANS; This Is a Tense Period at the Front, Both Sides Preparing for Action

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, May 1 -- "I don't know whether it's us or Fritz who's going to attack, but I do know there's going to be an offensive soon," an officer told me yesterday. He had arrived during the night from the front, tanned, spare and fit-looking, with the serenity that the front-line soldiers bring with them when they come into the capital.
abstract: USSR tactics in learning Ger plans, capture of Ger deserters and counter-propaganda moves described

byline.original: By RALPH PARKERWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
